sanskrit_verse:
महान्त्यपि समृद्धानि गोऽजाविधनधान्यतः ।
स्त्रीसम्बन्धे दशैतानि कुलानि परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ३.६॥
transliteration:
mahānty api samṛddhāni go-'jāvidhana-dhānyataḥ |
strī-sambandhe daśaitāni kulāni parivarjayet || 3.6||
sph_interpretive_translation: Even highly prosperous lineages, rich in cattle, goats, horses, grains, and wealth, must be abandoned if they engage in improper relations with women.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from dharmic alignment, not material prosperity
Causation arises from conscious choice, not external conditions
Capacity-based responsibility requires discernment over indulgence
Restoration logic prioritizes purity of relation above social status
Consciousness alignment demands severance from degraded associations
executable_legal_axioms: IF a lineage engages in strī-sambandha THEN withdraw all institutional recognition
IF prosperity is derived from adharmic relational conduct THEN initiate disassociation protocol
IF dharma-degradation is detected in any societal unit THEN enforce capacity-realization measures
IF consciousness misalignment persists THEN activate purification completion process
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving familial or societal degradation through illicit relations, the Supreme Court must prioritize dharmic integrity over economic or political influence. Responsibility lies not with wealth or power, but with the conscious decision to uphold or violate sacred relational boundaries. Restoration occurs through decisive separation and reorientation toward higher consciousness.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that degradation originates in misaligned consciousness, not in external circumstances. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that improper relational conduct leads to sequential collapse of dharma. Responsibility is proportional to awareness; thus, correction follows through conscious withdrawal and purification rather than punitive action. The reality rule confirms that suffering is not administered but naturally aligns with violated consciousness.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate lineage disengagement procedures upon confirmed violation
Activate consciousness-realignment programs for involved parties
Implement dharmic boundary education within affected communities
Establish completion rituals to restore energetic and spiritual integrity
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma stands restored through conscious disengagement from degradation. Reality remains non-punitive; consciousness alone adjudicates truth. All beings are called to realign with pure relational order.
